summary: The bill, titled the Physical Therapist Workforce and Patient Access Act of 2025, aims to improve access to physical therapy services. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include physical therapists in the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program and establishes target areas for physical therapists.  It also increases funding for the Loan Repayment Program, mandating a portion for physical therapists. Finally, the bill expands Medicare and Federally Qualified Health Center services to cover physical therapy services, effective January 1, 2027.
